meanings.sent1: The painting had a nebulous quality, making it hard to see the details.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were nebulous, leaving us confused about what to do next.
meanings.sent3: The nebulous map led us in circles, making our adventure more like a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of that day were nebulous, like trying to grasp smoke in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The nebulous dream left her feeling disoriented and lost upon waking.

meanings.sent1: The figure in the distance was nebulous, making it hard to identify who it was.
meanings.sent2: His explanation was so nebulous that no one could understand what he meant.
meanings.sent3: The nebulous plan to surprise her backfired when she found out too soon.
meanings.sent4: The future seemed nebulous, like a mist shrouding what was to come.
meanings.sent5: The nebulous outline of the mountain against the sunset was a breathtaking sight.
